result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel Erazo Santa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Straight time.  Concurrent with any current sentence.  Court grants 8 days credit

As an alternative payment of Costs, Court imposes the alternate sentence of 6 days jail time.  
COSTS PAID IN FULL

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

9:22 AM Defendant Angel Erazo Santa in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Angel Erazo Santa.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Defense confirms an interpreter is not needed for this hearing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1, 3 and 4 are dismissed and read in.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 2:
10 Days Jail - straight time.  (Credit - 8 days).  CONCURRENT with any current sentence.

COSTS: $ 243.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid forthwith.  Alternate 6 days jail.  Court imposes the alternate sentence.  Credit for 6 days.  COURT DEEMS FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS PAID.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:23 AM Defendant Angel Erazo Santa in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Angel Erazo Santa.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Ruth Garcia appeared by Zoom as interpreter and sworn in. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed. Attorney Griffis is asking for a quick plea/sentencing date and notes the defendant will NOT need an interpreter at the next hearing. The Court will set this matter for a quick plea/sentencing date before the Trial Court. The defendant is to remain in the Waukesha County Jail until the next hearing. AN INTERPRETER IS NOT NEEDED AT THE NEXT HEARING.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Witness list

10:06 AM Defendant Angel Erazo Santa appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Angel Erazo Santa.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advises he will need a Spanish interpreter and would like to be produced for his court hearings.
Court quashes warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of the Criminal Complaint and waives further reading.
Court sets cash bond in the amount of $50.00.
Defense requests a preliminary hearing within 10 days.
Defendant has a prompt disposition request on file.
Parties agree the prompt disposition deadline is 1/9/23.
Court will set the jury trial and jury status dates accordingly as well as a further proceedings date between the preliminary hearing and the jury status hearing.
Jury trial expected to last 1-2 days.  Court will select an alternate juror.  Each side is entitled to 5 strikes.  Clerk to prepare a trial order.
Clerk to prepare an order to produce for 10/12/22 for the preliminary hearing.  Defendant is then to remain in custody at the Waukesha County Jail pending the further proceedings on 10/31/22.
Clerk to prepare an order to produce for 12/12/22 for the jury status hearing and jury trial dates.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Jury status hearing on December 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
